channel.title: Xampp on vista
channel.description:
The mysql-php extension doesn't work in xampp on my 32-bit vista OS. I get the following error message: "Cannot load mysql extension. Please check your PHP configuration."
And yes, [code]extension=php_mysql.dll[/code] is uncommented.
I'm not going to use the computer for hosting; I just need xampp so I can easily/quickly test my php scripts and sites. I've been searching for a solution for ages, I even tried using wamp with no success.
Help please.
p.s. vista sux dique
Edit: Fixed. Zend Studio's php ini was interfering.

item.title: Xampp on vista
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you’re married to vista you could install linux inside virtualbox and use that as your server. Otherwise just install Kubuntu or something directly on the computer and use it.

Read full topic

item.title: Xampp on vista
item.dc:creator: @reVein reVein
item.description:
@reVein wrote:

I have 32-bit vista and xampp works for me, no problems. Tried reinstalling?

Read full topic

item.title: Xampp on vista
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Try opening the firewall or running it as administrator. Must be something wrong with your copy of Vista if that does not work. What is your PC brand?

If it is anything like HP or Dell, do not even try those sorts of things.

When I was using Vista on my PC (home built), xampp/wamp worked perfectly fine.

Also, try see what programs you have running, like Skype. Make sure to have all the dotnet frameworks installed. They are sometimes the problem with Web servers.

Read full topic

item.title: Xampp on vista

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:
